primaryaqsensor.label: Primary Air Quality Sensor:
primaryaqsensor.helper: Sets the Air Quality sensor to use for graphing and sending to third parties, leave undefined to suppress AQ graph data generation. Note: AirLink Indoor values are not sent to third parties or the default web page.

aqi.label: Air Quality Index:
aqi.helper: Select the AQI index calculation method you want to use

isNode.label: Added to station:
isNode.rightLabel: This AirLink has been added as a Node to my main WLL station
helpers: Enable this if you added the AirLink(s) as a node to an existing WLL weatherlink.com main station.
Disable if this if your AirLink(s) is configured as a standalone station, or has been added to a VP2/Vue or other type of station.

apiKey.label: WeatherLink API key:
helpers: Enter this only if your AirLink(s) is not added as a node to your main WeatherLink Live station

apiSecret.label: WeatherLink API secret:
apiSecret.helper: Enter this only if your AirLink is not added as a node to your mainWeatherLink Live station

autoUpdateIp.label: Auto-Discovery:
helpers: If you use DHCP, or do not know your AirLink IP address, this option will attempt to discover your AirLink for you and track any IP address changes.
If you use fixed IP addresses then you can enter them manually and leave this option disabled.

indoor.helper: AirLinks have to be defined as indoor or outdoor devices. The CumulusMX assignment MUST match the choice made on weatherlink.com

hostname.label: Airlink Hostname:
hostname.helper: You can enter the Airlink host name if you know it (lowercase). If you only have one Airlink device you can leave this blank and it will be populated for you

stationId.label: Station ID:
stationId.helper: Enter the weatherlink.com Station ID - you can leave this blank if you already entered it for your WLL device and this AirLink has been added as a node to the same station, it will be completed automatically

outdoor.helper: AirLinks have to be defined as indoor or outdoor devices. The CumulusMX assignment MUST match the choice made on weatherlink.com

hostname.label: Airlink Hostname:
hostname.helper: You can enter the Airlink host name if you know it (lowercase). If you only have one Airlink device you can leave this blank and it will be populated for you

stationId.label: Station ID:
stationId.helper: Enter the wetherlink.com Station ID - you can leave this blank if you already entered it for your WLL device and this AirLink has been added as a node to the same station, it will be copied automatically

extraStation.label: Select HTTP Station:
extraStation.helper: Sets the HTTP Station type to use for for sending additional sensor information to Cumulus.

helpers: Configure your Ecowitt station, or GW-1000 device to send data to Cumulus and the extra sensor data will be used in addition to your primary stations data
You must restart Cumulus after enabling/disabling this feature

useSolar.label: Solar
useSolar.rightLabel: Use the solar data from your Ecowitt

useUv.label: UV
useUv.rightLabel: Use the UV-I data from your Ecowitt

useTempHum.label: Extra Temp/Hum
useTempHum.rightLabel: Use the extra temperature/humidity sensor data from your Ecowitt

useSoilMoist.label: Soil Moisture
useSoilMoist.rightLabel: Use the soil moisture sensor data from your Ecowitt

useLeafWet.label: Leaf Wetness
useLeafWet.rightLabel: Use the leaf wetness sensor data from your Ecowitt

useUserTemp.label: User Temperature
useUserTemp.rightLabel: Use the WN34S/WN34L soil/water sensor data from your Ecowitt

useAQI.label: Air Quality
useAQI.rightLabel: Use the air quality sensor data from your Ecowitt

useCo2.label: Carbon Dioxide
useCo2.rightLabel: Use the CO₂ sensor data from your Ecowitt

useLightning.label: Lightning
useLightning.rightLabel: Use the lightning sensor data from your Ecowitt

useLeak.label: Leak
useLeak.rightLabel: Use the leak sensor data from your Ecowitt

setcustom.label: Enable Gateway Config:
setcustom.rightLabel: Allow Cumulus to configure your Ecowitt gateway for you
setcustom.helper: Enabling this feature automatically configures your gateway to send data to Cumulus MX

helpers: Configure your Ecowitt station, or Gateway  device to send data to Cumulus using the Ecowitt protocol

Manual Configuration: In WS View configure the Custom Server to use:-
Protocol: Ecowitt
Server: CMX IP Address
Path: /station/ecowittextra
Port: 8998
Interval: 20

gwaddr.label: Ecowitt Gateway devices IP address:
gwaddr.helper: You must enter the IP address of your gateway or station so that Cumulus can configure it

localaddr.label: Local Cumulus address:
localaddr.helper: You must enter the IP address of this Cumulus instance to which the Ecowitt gateway will send the data

interval.label: Update interval (seconds):
helpers: How often the Ecowitt gateway will send data to Cumulus (5-600)

Note: If you specify a time lower than 16 seconds, you will no longer be able to save the Web Server settings in the Ecowitt App. You will have to change the interval in the app back to 16 seconds in order to save other changes. Restarting Cumulus will restore the time you have set here.

primaryTHsensor.label: Primary Temp/Humidity sensor:
helpers: You can over-ride the default outdoor temperature and humidity sensor by specifying a WH31 T/H sensor channel
This over-ride only works if your primary station is an Ecowitt as well as your extra sensors

wn34chan1.label: WN34 chan 1:
wn34chan1.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan2.label: WN34 chan 2:
wn34chan2.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan3.label: WN34 chan 3:
wn34chan3.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan4.label: WN34 chan 4:
wn34chan4.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan5.label: WN34 chan 5:
wn34chan5.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan6.label: WN34 chan 6:
wn34chan6.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan7.label: WN34 chan 7:
wn34chan7.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

wn34chan8.label: WN34 chan 8:
wn34chan8.helper: Select the mapping for your WN34 sensor

helpers: Configure your Ambient station, or WH2600/Observer IP device to send data to Cumulus and the extra sensor data will be used in addition to your primary stations data

In the awnet app configure the Custom Server to use:-
Protocol: Ambient Weather
Server: CMX IP Address
Path: /station/ambientextra?
Port: 8998
Interval: 20
You must restart Cumulus after enabling/disabling this feature

useSolar.label: Solar
useSolar.rightLabel: Use the solar data from your Ambient

useUv.label: UV
useUv.rightLabel: Use the UV-I data from your Ambient

useTempHum.label: Extra Temp/Hum
useTempHum.rightLabel: Use the extra temperature/humidity sensor data from your Ambient

useSoilMoist.label: Soil Moisture
useSoilMoist.rightLabel: Use the soil moisture sensor data from your Ambient

useAQI.label: Air Quality
useAQI.rightLabel: Use the air quality sensor data from your Ambient

useLightning.label: Lightning
useLightning.rightLabel: Use the lightning sensor data from your Ambient

useLeak.label: Leak
useLeak.rightLabel: Use the leak sensor data from your Ambient

enabled.rightLabel: Use a Blake-Larsen sunshine recorder for sunshine hours
enabled.helper: Use an attached Blake-Larsen sun recorder to determine hours of sunshine - reads the SRsunshine.dat file

tipMode.label: Detection Mode:
tipMode.helper: Disabled puts the device into "It's raining" mode

tipSize.label: Tip Size:
tipSize.helper: The tip size in the units Cumulus is configured to use for rain

dtrMode.label: Connection Mode:
dtrMode.helper: Unselected puts this device in RTS/CTS mode. If two RG-11 devices share a serial port, one must be DTR mode, the other in RTS mode

tipMode.label: Detection Mode:
tipMode.helper: Disabled puts the device in "It's raining" mode

tipSize.label: Tip Size:
tipSize.helper: The tip size in the units Cumulus is configured to use for rain

dtrMode.label: Connection Mode:
dtrMode.helper: Unselected puts this device in RTS/CTS mode. If two RG-11 devices share a serial port, one must be DTR mode, the other in RTS mode
